title: Minority threatens to compel finance minister over cocoa arrears
desc: The Minority in Parliament has served notice that it is prepared to take steps to compel the Finance Minister, Cassiel Ato Forson, to appear before the House over mounting concerns about delayed payments to cocoa farmers.

title: Dawood Lawrencepur to Finally Merge with DH Partners and Cyan
desc: Dawood Lawrencepur Limited has announced that the Islamabad High Court has approved a scheme of amalgamation involving DH Partners Limited and Cyan

title: Air France-KLM says US travel ‘improving’
desc: Rising spending on first and business class boosts annual profits

title: HESLB Turns to Private Sector to Bridge Student Loan Gap
desc: Tanzania’s higher education loan authority is partnering with private entities to expand its reach as demand for student financing outstrips public funds.

title: Sweden ViDA VAT amendments proposed for 2027
desc: Sweden ViDA VAT amendments propose cross-border clarifications, extended OSS regimes, and new platform supply rules effective January 1, 2027.

title: Flash flood risk in Jurong East and Pioneer areas
desc: Commuters are advised to avoid Jurong East and Pioneer areas due to a high risk of flash floods from heavy rain on Feb 19. Read more at straitstimes.com.

title: Real Madrid prepares for the match against Osasuna
desc: Arbeloa's team faces Osasuna at El Sadar on matchday 25 of La Liga (Saturday, 6:30 pm CEST; Orange TV and Dazn).

title: Winter Olympics 2026 LIVE: Day 13
desc: Day 13 of the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics as Team GB's women and men look to reach the curling semi-finals.

title: At least 6 familicide cases recorded in 2026 as Malaysia vows to strengthen social support services
desc: The latest killing of family members took place on Tuesday (Feb 17) in Pahang, in which a 32-year-old man allegedly murdered his wife, mother and two young daughters aged two and four with a sharp blade before killing himself.

title: Ex-South Korea leader Yoon gets life sentence for insurrecti
desc: A South Korean court sentenced ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison after finding him guilty of insurrection for his 2024 martial law declaration.
